alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 09 at 2:15PM CDT until May 09 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Orleans Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 215 PM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans and Lakefront Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 233 and 245. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
